pages.text: Apotheosis revamps how enchanting is done. You can now get higher than level 30 enchantments, and a lot of enchantments can go higher than they normally can.

pages.title: Modifiers
pages.text: $(a)Eterna$(): Eterna is the value used when determining what level of enchantment you are going to get. For example: An Eterna value of 15 will get you level 30 enchanting. $(br2)$(4)Quanta$(): Quanta determince the variance in your enchantment power. A 43% quanta with a level 30 enchantment will cause your enchant value to vary between level 17 and 43. $(br2)$(5)Arcana$(): A higher level of Arcana will cause rare enchantments to become more common and will increase the number of enchantments you will get.$(br2)

pages.title: Removing Enchants
pages.text: The Tome of Hungering Knowledge is good for removing enchantments off of an item into a book. $(br)It also does not destroy the item that has the enchantments on it.
Placing an enchanted anvil with splitting over a book with multiple enchantments and letting it crush the book will cause the enchantments from that book to split off into their own books.
The Enchantment Library can store all of your enchantments and you can take out specific enchants at specific levels onto a book.
It is recommended that once you get both the Enchantment Library and a very high level of enchanting to enchant with books and then put those enchants into the library.
